roleset.name: to break, undergo damage, possibly producing a characteristic sound, possibly resulting in a sound
roleset.note: CRASH-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of VNcls bump-18.4-1, break-45.1, sound_emission-43.2. (from crash.01-v)
CRASH-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls break-45.1, sound_emission-43.2, and bump-18.4-1. (from crash.01-n)

example.name: intransitive
example.text: `` They still bear the memory of October 1987 , when they bought gold after the stock market crashed and ended up [*-2] losing money because gold prices subsequently fell [*T*-3], '' Mr. Nichols said [*T*-1] .

example.name: with direction
example.text: The USS Lexington returned to dock in Pensacola , Fla. , following an accident Sunday in which the pilot of a training jet crashed into the ship , [*-2] killing five sailors [*T*-1].
example.arg: the pilot of a training jet

example.name: with GOL
example.text: the actual crash of the car into the lagoon

roleset.name: to enter uninvited, invite oneself in
roleset.note: CRASH-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. No VNcls. (from crash.02-v)
CRASH-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on PB crash.02. No Vncls. (from crash.02-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Name-dropping recently helped Mr. Houston-Montgomery crash a party [0] Fame magazine threw [*T*-1]for 100 of the 2,809 people mentioned [*] in the diaries of the late Andy Warhol .
example.arg: a party [0] Fame magazine threw [*T*-1]for 100 of the 2,809 people mentioned [*] in the diaries of the late Andy Warhol

example.text: he remembers Kendallman?s spectacular crash of the party, when he set up his own ?booth? that was an installation of another version of an invasion of Puerto Rico.

example.text: His gate crash at Reese's birthday

example.name: arg0
example.text: Yo dawg . Sorry I did nt get back . Got a new phone today and just set it up . You can totally crash wed .

example.name: transitive
example.text: While TV commercials typically take weeks [*] to produce [*?*], advertisers-1 in the past couple of years have learned [*-1]-2 to turn on a dime , [*-2] to crash out ads in days or even hours .
